After LA and DC deployments, Trump wants wider National Guard role in law enforcement
description: By ordering the creation of a special unit in each of the 50 states to maintain public order on Monday, August 25, the Republican president aims to normalize the presence of military personnel in the streets and to federalize public security policy.

description: The Seine reopened to swimmers last month, marking the first time since 1923 that bathers could take the plunge in the waterway following a years-long clean-up effort.

headline: Channel's 'cocaine fishermen' prove valuable allies for organized crime
description: The arrest of several fishermen in April exposed a trafficking operation that specialized investigators often describe as 'underestimated.' The scheme involves sending small trawlers out to sea to retrieve drugs dropped in the wake of cargo ships.

headline: At the Venice Film Festival, French filmmakers take on literary adaptation
description: Valérie Donzelli, François Ozon, Cédric Jimenez and Olivier Assayas are all presenting films adapted from novels at the Mostra, running from August 27 to September 6.

headline: Macron ignored reports advising against transport of Bayeux Tapestry
description: Le Monde has learned that two expert reports from 2021 and 2022 warned against transporting the millennium-old artwork, which is to be loaned to Britain and exhibited in London in September 2026.

headline: Life in the West Bank settlement of Kedem Arava: 'We're not taking anyone's place, there is only sand around us'
description: Established in 2017 near the Jordanian border, the Kedem Arava settlement contains prefabricated homes housing some 60 families, former city dwellers seeking a life closer to nature. While most residents deny ideological motivation, their presence fully aligns with the annexation of Palestinian territory sought by the Israeli far right.

headline: In Iowa, soul-searching Democrats want revenge
description: In a rural state that swung Republican in 2016, Democrats are trying to unite those angered by cuts to welfare programs.
